After finishing his Communication Studies in 1997 Koen co-founded AyZee, one of the first online advertising agencies in the Netherlands. He left AyZee to become co-founder/co-owner of .bone, where he was creative director. Verhagen created award-winning work for mayor advertisers including Monsterboard, Hewlett Packard, Staatsloterij, Pepsi, ABN AMRO, MSN a.o. .bone won Best Dutch interactive agency award in 2008.

Verhagen was a jurymember of several advertising-awards including Spin Awards, ADCN, Magneet and EFFIE (2004-2007). He left .bone in 2009 to broaden his creative horizon. In 2011 he co-founded Skylines.

Verhagen is also co-founder of MaartenMemorial (2004-) A Dutch charity event to commemorate a friend, who died of cancer at the age of 27. Each year 100 exotic sportcars take cancerpatients to the Zandvoort racetrack to let them forget their illness for one day.
